I didn't address this point:

2008/12/22 petar_chervenski <petar_chervenski@...>:
> Suppose that 2 genomes have many disjoint genes with respect
> to each other, if they are both represented as zeroes, this would mean
> they are closer in space?

Yes that's right. And this is effectively why I backtracked and
hypothesised that the L1/manhattan distance (which is what we are
effectively using currently) is better than the L2/Euclidean distance.
I think it would be an interesting experiment to try out thse
different distance metrics and see some experimental data to back up
the hypothesis.

Cheers,

Colin.
